rComments: Barahona is a very good profesor. His lessons are clear cut and easily understood. Expectations are clearly communicated through the syllabus. While he will let you make up tests and quizzes you missed (with good reason), he won't do so without making you feel slightly bad about missing. Overall great teacher, quizzes every friday.

Pretty much what you need in a language teacher. Very clear and helpful, gets along with students well. There WILL be homework every night, but it's never anything too tough, just a lot of it. He really wants to help all the students though and will change how the class works if it means everyone will be able to handle it. Would take again.

Really enjoyed Prof. Barahona's class. Class was enjoyable, though his Spanish immersion wasn't so strict (partially because of the many students who got bad grades in Spanish 2 -- not his fault!). Online homework was easy; not too much of it. I feel like my Spanish improved greatly in this class.

Barahona cares about his students and encourages speaking Spanish inside the classroom, but he isn't the best at actually teaching. When students had grammar questions he presented information in a confusing, disorganized manner and always went at a fast pace. Easy to get an A in the class, but I honestly feel like I wounded up teaching myself..

Professor Barahona is a relatively easy teacher. He is considerate about students and would sometimes ask the class what he could do to improve lecture. I learned much with this professor.I definitely solidified my grammar, and improved my vocabulary and my debating skills in his class. We used the Senderos textbook a lot for homework in class.

Professor Barahona is a relatively easy teacher, but very serious. I had him for Spanish 4 and Spanish 6 and the classes are the same every day. It can get really boring but I feel like I solidified my grammar, fluency and arguing my opinions. He is really organized but made me use the textbook for Spanish 4, useless! Span 6 it was optional.
Very nice. he was very friendly and really tries to help out. he's very clear about his stuff and he teaches out of the book. exams aren't too difficult if you studied for a decent amount of time

Byron is an adequate facilitator for seminars but not an ensnaring lecturer. The actual core class (80B) is pretty straight forward. Life of the class mainly depends on how many people actually did and understood the reading.
He's a nice guy who definitely tries, but he teaches right from the book which makes attending pointless. Plus, it is extremely boring and it was painful making myself go to his class.

Professor Barahona is friendly the class is extremely boring. Everything is to the text, which is an awful way to teach a language in my opinion. The exams and papers were not very hard. There are two oral presentations with were graded so so.
